item.description:
Apologies for the late posting. The French Film Festival always sneaks up faster than I expect it to, but I've got two events posted for this weekend and I may add another sometime later during the run (til the 29th). I hope you can catch something during the festival, which always offers something interesting. Advance purchase of tickets is always advised.

About the film:

A Happy Event (Un heureux événement) by Rémi Bezançon (2011, 110 min.). Barbara, a young graduate student, is madly in love with her boyfriend Nicolas when she learns she is pregnant. Initially shocked, Barbara oscillates between excitement and trepidation, but once the baby is born, everything becomes alarmingly real, and they are faced with the reality of raising a child. An honest and humorous portrayal of first-time parents coping with the happiness, anxiety, and fear that comes with life-changing experiences. “Sexy and humorous . . . Bezançon is that rare French helmer whose abilities exceed those of many Hollywood comedy directors” (Variety).

After the film we'll go to an area restaurant for discussion.

Hope you can make it!

Lisa
item.how_to_find_us: After the film I'll be near the front of the theater with a Meetup sign.
item.name: A Happy Event -- French Film Festival @ MFA
